data.title: Excellent
data.text: Great history and a beautiful church! In today's hustle and bustle world,it is nice to step back and reset yourself!  Great well cared for cemetery stones and a beautiful spot!

data.title: Beautifully simple and historic
data.text: This is probably the oldest extant church in full use in the Wilmington area. Simple and full of local history. Founded by the original settlers, now an Episcopal church.  Historic burial ground surrounds it, and a very moving venue for services and small weddings - up to perhaps 200 people.

data.title: Wow!
data.text: This is a place that I have wanted to visit for a long time and it did not disappoint! The church cemetery is loaded with historic graves and there are signs that explain the role of the people in history whose remains are buried there. We had a guided tour where the guide explained everything in detail and you could tell she was proud of the site! The history, architecture, and past and current life of the congregation were discussed. The church building was beautiful and simple and yet profound. Each seat, brick, tile, and window exudes history and a story that is waiting to be told. And told it was! This is a gem!!

data.title: An Old Treasure
data.text: Old Swedes is a beautiful old church, built in 1699 by Swedish immigrants, that still retains much of what it was all those years ago. The cemetery has 44 Revolutionary War veterans buried in it, a Secretary of State under President Grover Cleveland and four U.S. Senators. For minimal cost, $5 per person, you can get a personal guided tour inside the church by someone who knows the history. The floor is made of bricks that were used as ballast in ships 300+ years ago. We found graffiti carved in a door from 1711 and 1798. It is simple and beautiful and oozes history. And we got to pull the cord and ring the church bell! I highly recommend a visit.

data.title: Santa Lucia Program
data.text: The Santa Lucia Program was excellent. It was a womderful way to celebrate the Advent season.The young people in the program sang carols in Swedish. Two teens played the violin beautifully. The music was very inspiring.

data.title: Wow...Great tour!!!
data.text: One the most fascinating and informative tours I have ever had. Our tour guide was a graduate student in archaeology and anthropology...excited about what she was sharing and made it relevant...would return...I believe it cost $5 per person to take the tour, but you copuld walk around the church and cemetery for free...

data.title: Lots of information on the beginnings of the Delaware colony
data.text:
We went to a Ghost Walk there and were surprised that it was not about ghostly happenings at the church, but historical walk on early Wilmington.  Re-enactors would pop up at certain graves and tell about their lives and their impact on the times.  It was very interesting.  We learned a lot and even Googled  different people to learn more.

Christmas time is also a wonderful time to visit as they have beautiful Swedish Christmas customs and church services.

There is also a historic Swedish house to see and a large graveyard with many names from Wilmington history.

data.title: Great Surprise!
data.text: We were going to skip the tour, just take a quick photo and stroll around the cemetery for a few minutes.  I'm so glad the hostess talked us into taking the tour.  Our guide had great stories of the people who establish this colony and this church building.  It was totally worth the time and price of admission.  highly recommend a visit

data.title: A step way back in history
data.text: A step way back in history to the 1600's.  I have been here numerous times with kids, family and for church.  Always very awe inspiring to me to be able to step back in tme this way.  Very well done.

data.title: Very Historical Church and Cemetery
data.text: Since my husband had an ancestor buried in the adjoining cemetery, we stopped to see the church and take a tour. The docent was lovely to answer questions and each tour can be tailored and timed to your interests. We learned about the Swedish, Dutch and British occupations of Wilmington and how the church has been there throughout it all. Parking is by the adjacent house on cobblestones. Since the church has been added to National Park status, there is some signage but it is still easy to take a wrong turn or two. At the end of your tour, you get to ring the church bell. It's kind of a fun thing to do!

data.title: A Quiet Treat With A Lot Of History Behind It
data.text:
This old church was an unexpected treat. Don't expect anything grand or on a large scale. Do expect a visit to a historical site which has a great history and is a key component to the "New Sweden" element of the history of the U. S.  

This is church and grounds which are tucked away a bit but worth taking the side trip if you have an interest in history.  When you arrive here you will find a beautiful mid-size church built around 350 years ago, a fairly large cemetery surrounding much of the church and an adjoining building which is a combo of an admin site, museum and very small store. It is all incredibly well maintained.

If you stop by you will find them quite willing to give a personal tour and the tour can likely be tailored to fit your available time and preferences.  This was quite a treat and we can't thank our guide enough for the incredible tour she provided.

If you have an interest in Swedish heritage as it pertains to the U.S. this is all the more fascinating and worthwhile.

data.title: Oldest church still having services
data.text: despite being a bit out of the way, a day trip to Old Swedes Church is worth the effort. The tour is very informative and you get to ring the bell as an added treat. The graveyard is a compendium of Wilmington history. The tour guide is well informed and loves to have people of Swedish descent stop by.

data.title: You don't need to be Swedish to enjoy this historic site.
data.text: Very well maintained and still active parish from the 1700's. The guide will give some great insight to the early history of the Swedish settlers and the times. The building itself is quite interesting with the buttresses added to maintain it's stability. Nice one hour tour.

data.title: franksgogetter
data.text: I've seen this church back in the 50's on a school trip,  we had a test on this the next week I remembered  some of the tour I got a C on my test .  it goes back to the 1700th hundreds  of North America an the colonies . the parking is not that great so come early.  the graves go back to the 1690's an they are taken care of them very good,  there are no fees so  the tours ask for a donation so please help .

data.title: Very important site
data.text: This is the oldest continually used church is the USA, and as such has a pretty fascinating story to tell. Got taken around by a nicest guide who gave me a great history of the site and even let me ring the bells in the tower. Highly recommend this on any tour of Delaware where there's some interest in history.

data.title: The oldest continually used church in America. Who knew?
data.text: Found this little gem in Wilmington during a visit to the Philadelphia area. It is a remarkable historic site, which dates back to the late 1600s. It was the heart of Swedish attempt to colonize a portion of North America. Incredible history, amazing site, and a dedicated nonprofit group helping keep the history alive. Our tour guide was exceptionally nice and knowledgable. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the Wilmington area and appreciate colonial era history "off the beaten path."

data.title: Historic 1698 Church in Wilmington
data.text: We were visting the area and stopped at this historic church near the river in Wilmington.  The church was built in 1698 by the Swedes who controlled the area at that time.  It is an interesting small church with lovely stained glass windows and the oldest pulpit in the US.  Around the church is a large burial grounds with many historic markers.  The church and the 1690 Hendricks House can be seen with a guided tour for a donation of $5.  The church is still in use and has weekly services and scheduled concerts during the year.  There is a small parking lot near the church.

data.title: Old Swedes church
data.text: Vi var på rundresa i USA i sommar och besökte även Wilmington och då passade vi på att besöka Old Swedes Church. Vi hade turen att komma precis när guiden kom för att öppna kl 10. Vi tittade på kyrkogården med en mängd gamla gravstenar med svenska namn. Lite speciellt eftersom vi är från Sverige. Vi fick även gå in i kyrkan och i Hendrickson House där det kostade 5 dollar per person i donation. Där fanns det även svenska böcker och souvenirer att köpa. Stort tack till den duktiga guiden som visade oss runt. Kyrkan är fortfarande i gång och där har man gudtjänster och Luciafirande i december.
